title: Sri Lanka stock market sees strong recovery after two day plunge
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock market rebound sharply on Wednesday after two days of steep fall when the market opened after two-week break.
As at 11.10am, the ASPI was 4.14 percent or 285.96 points up to 7,191.33.
Most liquid index S&P SL20 also jumped 8.87 percent or 188.57 points to 2,314.53.
Market turnover was 1.15 billion rupees compared to the previous day’s total of 800 million total turnover.
Analysts have predicted the market to gain on Wednesday, after the trading was closed prematurely following the S&P index plunged over 10 percent on the both previous days.

The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) was closed from April 11 to 18 due to a traditional new year however during that period Sri Lanka hiked rates to 7-percent, announced a soft-default and began IMF discussions. The CSE also closed the market for another five days, citing investors need s cool off period to make informed decisions.
Shares in Expolanka. Browns Investment and Hayleys were the top gainers on Wednesday.
In the last two days market has plunged over 15 percent and the trading was closed within minutes after it opened.
The stock exchange has circuit breakers at 5.0 percent, 7.5 percent and 10.00 percent after which the market is closed. (Colombo/April27/2022)
